citations.narrative:
The handling of animals at the facility was not being performed in a manner to prevent trauma or physical harm. On 4
June 2024 a rabbit being used in an IACUC approved protocol sustained injuries after jumping out of an employee’s
hands during manual restraint while unwrapping an applied bandage utilized as described in the protocol. The rabbit
landed on the corner of the restraint device on its side and then landed on the ground. The animal was observed twitching
and going in and out of consciousness. The animal died shortly after the incident. The necropsy report dated 4 June 2024
revealed the cause of death as a pulmonary contusion with subsequent hemorrhaging due to laceration from fractured
ribs.
The facility was unable to ensure that all animals being handled were done in a manner that does not cause trauma or
physical harm. The registrant must ensure that the handling of all animals by personnel shall be done as expeditiously
and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress,
physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.
Corrective measures had been implemented prior to inspection including but not limited to additional employee retraining,
personnel actions, and developing a new injury investigative method to track patterns or issues with employees regarding
job performance. The facility states no incidents have been observed following implementation of corrective actions.
There were no additional handling non-compliances observed at the time of inspection.
To remain corrected from 30 April 2025 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
The handling of animals at the facility was not being performed in a manner to prevent trauma or physical harm. On 4 
June 2024 a rabbit being used in an IACUC approved protocol sustained injuries after jumping out of an employee’s 
hands during manual restraint while unwrapping an applied bandage utilized as described in the protocol. The rabbit 
landed on the corner of the restraint device on its side and then landed on the ground. The animal was observed twitching 
and going in and out of consciousness. The animal died shortly after the incident. The necropsy report dated 4 June 2024 
revealed the cause of death as a pulmonary contusion with subsequent hemorrhaging due to laceration from fractured 
ribs.  
 
The facility was unable to ensure that all animals being handled were done in a manner that does not cause trauma or 
physical harm. The registrant must ensure that the handling of all animals by personnel shall be done as expeditiously 
and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, 
physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.  
 
Corrective measures had been implemented prior to inspection including but not limited to additional employee retraining, 
personnel actions, and developing a new injury investigative method to track patterns or issues with employees regarding 
job performance. The facility states no incidents have been observed following implementation of corrective actions. 
There were no additional handling non-compliances observed at the time of inspection.  
 
To remain corrected from 30 April 2025 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
